definition: tonic
to repair/to patch/to mend/to make up for/to fill (a vacancy)/to supplement
medicine/drug/substance used for a specific purpose (e.g. poisoning, explosion, fermenting)/CL:種|种[zhong3],服[fu4],味[wei4]/to poison
leaf of the iris/variant of 藥|药[yao4]

sentences.english: Cordyceps sinensis is a famous and nourishing herb in traditional Chinese medicine.
sentences.chinese: 冬虫夏草为名贵滋补药。

sentences.english: Strictly speaking, "tonic" has the sub-tonic and tonic.
sentences.chinese: 严格地讲，“补药”有补药和补品之分。

sentences.english: Strictly speaking, "tonic" has the sub-tonic and tonic.
sentences.chinese: 严格地讲，“补药”有补药和补品之分。

sentences.english: Eat invigorator while can you eat hot?
sentences.chinese: 吃补药的同时能吃辣的吗？

sentences.english: The salesman proclaimed that his tonic would cure all ills.
sentences.chinese: 销售商说他的补药能医百病。
任何补药服用过量都有害。

sentences.english: This tonic will help you get well.
sentences.chinese: 这种补药会帮助你恢复健康的。

sentences.english: Vitamin C is much more than just a tonic for resisting colds.
sentences.chinese: 维生素C决不仅仅是可以御寒的补药。

sentences.english: The mere possibility of Chinese support was a tonic for European markets.
sentences.chinese: 光是得到中国金援的可能性对欧洲市场都是一剂补药。

sentences.english: This tonic should pick you up .
sentences.chinese: 这种补药会增强你的体质。

sentences.english: Anyway, caterpillar fungus is one of the traditional Chinese tonics . It's good for your health.
sentences.chinese: 总之，虫草是一处中药补药，有益于身体健康。

definition: tonic
medicinal dietary supplement that helps build up one's health
a person who is in poor health cannot handle sth so strong as a tonic
nourishing/nutritious
to take a tonic or nourishing food to build up one's health
medicinal cuisine
tonic/invigorant
tonic food (food considered to be particularly healthful)/to eat such foods
tisane/decoction (Chinese medicine)
(TCM) to build up one's kidney yang/to boost male sex drive
medicine/drug/substance used for a specific purpose (e.g. poisoning, explosion, fermenting)/CL:種|种[zhong3],服[fu4],味[wei4]/to poison
leaf of the iris/variant of 藥|药[yao4]
(traditional) Chinese medicine/CL:服[fu4],種|种[zhong3]
effective cure, miracle medicine (idiom); fig. wonder-cure for all problems/panacea/elixir
the benefits of medicine are not as great as those of good nutrition
pinyin: yao4 bu3 bu4 ru2 shi2 bu3

definition: benefit/help
every medicine has its side effect
